string.text: Enable or disable the MAI mod entirely. When disabled, NPCs will ignore anomalies completely.
Enable debug logging to console. Shows detection, damage, and death events.
Enable verbose debug logging. Shows update loop, cache rebuilds, and config details. Very spammy!
Show all detected anomalies on the PDA map as markers. Useful for debugging why NPCs get stuck. Toggle off to remove markers.
Remove anomaly markers left on the PDA map from previous MAI versions. Enable this, apply settings, then disable it again. One-time cleanup action.
How far NPCs can detect anomalies (in meters). Higher values = earlier detection but more restrictions. Default: 30m
Maximum length of restriction string per NPC. If exceeded, new anomalies won't be added. Default: 2048
Seconds to wait after surge/psy-storm before rebuilding anomaly cache. Allows Arrival mod to finish respawning anomalies. Set to 0 if not using Arrival. Default: 2.5s
NPCs outside this radius from player are protected from anomaly damage. Improves performance and prevents distant NPCs from dying. Default: 300m
If enabled, NPCs will try to avoid anomalies regardless of distance from player. If disabled, only NPCs within effect radius get pathfinding restrictions. Default: Enabled
When NPC gets stuck near anomalies, actively make them run to a safe position instead of just clearing restrictions. Uses pathfinding to find cover away from the closest anomaly. Default: Enabled
Minimum distance (in meters) to flee from the anomaly. NPC will try to get at least this far away. Default: 15m
Maximum distance to search for a safe position. If no position found within this range, NPC will just have restrictions cleared. Default: 40m
Seconds before NPC can receive new anomaly restrictions after fleeing. Higher values give NPCs more time to move away. Default: 30s
Distance (meters) to anomaly to consider NPC in urgent danger. NPCs closer than this will trigger faster stuck detection. Default: 5m
NPCs only throw bolts when near multiple anomalies (dense anomaly field). Prevents constant bolt throwing near single anomalies. Default: Enabled
Minimum number of anomalies nearby for NPC to start throwing bolts. Lower = more bolt throwing. Default: 3
Radius (in meters) to check for anomaly clusters. Anomalies within this distance count toward the minimum. Default: 25m

Apply damage multipliers based on NPC's equipped outfit. Protection values are read directly from outfit configs (burn, shock, chemical, radiation, psy, strike). An exoskeleton with 0.7 shock protection takes only 30% electric anomaly damage.
NPCs with 0% miss chance (Veterans+) become completely immune to anomaly damage. Safety net for experienced stalkers. Default: Enabled
Prevent anomalies from activating on dead NPC bodies. Stops ragdoll physics glitches and improves performance. Default: Enabled
Miss chance multiplier when NPC is standing still. Lower = more careful. Default: 0.3x
Miss chance multiplier when NPC is walking. Default: 0.6x
Miss chance multiplier when NPC is running. Higher = more likely to miss anomalies. Default: 1.2x
Miss chance multiplier when NPC is in combat. Distracted NPCs are much more likely to run into anomalies. Default: 3.0x
Base miss chance for Novice stalkers. 100% = always might walk into anomalies. Default: 100%
Base miss chance for Trainee stalkers. Default: 75%
Base miss chance for Experienced stalkers. Default: 50%
Base miss chance for Professional stalkers. Default: 25%
Base miss chance for Veteran stalkers. 0% = never walks into anomalies. Default: 0%
Base miss chance for Expert stalkers. Default: 0%
Base miss chance for Master stalkers. Default: 0%
Base miss chance for Legend stalkers. Default: 0%
